headline: Palantir Deepens Global AI Infrastructure Role With HD Hyundai And Sovereign AI
summary: Palantir Technologies (NasdaqGS:PLTR) has expanded its alliance with HD Hyundai, its largest and longest collaboration in Korea. The HD Hyundai deal broadens use of Palantir's AI across multiple industrial units, adds new pilots, and includes plans for an AI Center of Excellence. Separately, Sovereign AI selected Palantir, alongside Accenture, to help build sovereign grade AI data centers and infrastructure across EMEA. These agreements increase Palantir's role in commercial and government...

headline: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

content.title: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
content.summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

headline: 'Sit tight,' it's still early innings in AI trade: Strategist
summary: Laffer Tengler Investments CEO and CIO Nancy Tengler shares her perspective on the state of Big Tech and the AI trade's progress, including taking a closer look at Palantir Technologies (PLTR), which will be reporting earnings results after Monday's market close. Also hear Nancy Tengler's thoughts on Disney's (DIS) latest headlines in the company's CEO search and how volatility is working its way through gold prices (GC=F) and precious metals commodities. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Also hear Nancy Tengler's thoughts on Disney's (DIS) latest headlines in the company's CEO search and how volatility is working its way through gold prices (GC=F) and precious metals commodities.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Exploring US High Growth Tech Stocks In February 2026
summary: As the United States stock market kicks off February with a rise in major indices like the Dow Jones and S&P 500, investors are keeping a close watch on economic indicators and geopolitical developments that could impact market dynamics. In this environment of fluctuating oil prices and evolving monetary policy, identifying high-growth tech stocks involves assessing companies' ability to innovate and adapt amidst changing economic conditions.

headline: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ:PLTR) Delivers Impressive Q4 CY2025, Growth To Accelerate Next Year
summary: Data analytics company Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ:PLTR) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 70% year on year to $1.41 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($1.53 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 15.3% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.25 per share was 8.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ:PLTR) Delivers Impressive Q4 CY2025, Growth To Accelerate Next Year
content.summary: Data analytics company Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ:PLTR) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 70% year on year to $1.41 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($1.53 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 15.3% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.25 per share was 8.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Palantir stock jumps on Q4 earnings, CEO comments on value of AI
summary: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) is out with its fourth quarter results, topping Wall Street's expectations around adjusted earnings ($0.25 per share vs. estimates of $0.23) and revenue ($1.41 billion vs. estimates of $1.33 billion). The software company's stock is jumping in after-hours trading on this news. Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton dives into the earnings release and Palantir's guidance figures, noting CEO Alex Karp's comments to Yahoo Finance about the value of AI and the AI competition between geopolitical rivals. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

Palantir Technologies (PLTR) is out with its fourth quarter results, topping Wall Street's expectations around adjusted earnings ($0.25 per share vs. estimates of $0.23) and revenue ($1.41 billion vs. estimates of $1.33 billion). The software company's stock is jumping in after-hours trading on this news.

Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton dives into the earnings release and Palantir's guidance figures, noting CEO Alex Karp's comments to Yahoo Finance about the value of AI and the AI competition between geopolitical rivals.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
